imt: dog	skinny-\textsc{abs}	there	underneath	go.down 	go\textsc{;pst}
trs: \sqt{The skinny dog went down underneath there.}\\
\sqt{A plane has landed.}\\
\sqt{‎‎My father was at the head of Mulume creek, and…}\\

src: [saːgoi ɛjalɛ motuwɛ ɛjalɛ gɛdajoɸa sɛdɛ hɛna mi-jaː]\textsubscript{final}
trs: \sqt{‎‎‎Sagoi and Motuwe came while beating tree trunks (so their approach would be heard).}\\

imt: \textsc{contr} this dog bony=‎\textsc{top} this inside lie-‎\textsc{sim} be-‎\textsc{cont} this hear be-‎\textsc{ds}
src: [[no	wɛ	aːɡɛ	kɛɡa=jaː]\textsubscript{topic}	wɛ	suwɛ	da-li	lɛ-ki	wɛ	dɛdɛ	laː-\textbf{bi}]\textsubscript{final}
trs: \sqt{This one, this bony dog who was still inside was listening to this.}\\
\sqt{We were living there and a visitor did that (came).}\\
\sqt{I will tell about what butterflies do.}\\
\sqt{There being a butterfly then there is an egg.}\\
\sqt{There being an egg then there is a caterpillar.}\\
\sqt{There being caterpillar then there is a pupa.}\\
\sqt{There being a pupa then there is a butterfly.}\\
\sqt{The (story of) butterfly behavior is finished.}\\
\sqt{Tree kangaroos, Gomoolo had gone hunting (for those animals)…}\\
\sqt{...and (he) had shot one (a tree kangaroo).}\\
\sqt{Taking another bag, I went up.}\\
\sqt{If your children are to go to school, then find a teacher!}\\
\sqt{I heard a cassowary come and make noise.}\\
\sqt{I heard that, and (I thought) it was not real (i.e., a spirit).}\\
\sqt{‎‎(The other sleeping space being made like this,) measure there.}\\
\sqt{‎‎That being done, go and cut the posts.}\\
\sqt{(You) should shave it properly}\\
\sqt{Flatten it properly (by shaving) and then…}\\
\sqt{Keep shaving it thin, when it’s shaved thin, take the other side, and then…}\\
\sqt{(You) should wrap the rope going up.}\\
\sqt{Then put it on there.}\\
\sqt{Do that and then…}\\
\sqt{…then tie that rope on there and finish.}\\
\sqt{Usaja came and married her.}\\
\sqt{He was doing that, so this guy, this Ugei came there.}\\
\sqt{They continued struggling and fell to the ground.}\\
\sqt{‎‎They did that and then I saw (Hauwa) call to the men.}\\
\sqt{He said, ``Dobuwe!''}\\
\sqt{He did that and I saw them go ``whaa!''}\\
\sqt{I did that (saw them) and they came.}\\
\sqt{He said ``What happened to you?''.}\\
\sqt{‎‎He did (said) that, so (I said) ``My leg is swollen, this one.''}\\
‎\sqt{‎He had already gone up there to plant pandanus seeds.}\\
\sqt{He did that, I was still alone here.}\\
\sqt{That being the case, I was wandering around here.}\\
\sqt{That had happened and then…}\\
\sqt{when I was still small…}\\
\sqt{This knee was down and then…}\\
\sqt{It was burned on that fire.}\\
\sqt{That happened and this is the scar.}\\
\sqt{That happened and I didn't know (about it).}\\
\sqt{That happened, and my father, he told (me about it) so…}\\
\sqt{I know about that (story).}\\
\sqt{Then weave (the strands) going up.}\\
\sqt{The two ends are joined together.}\\
\sqt{Having woven (the strands) together, then that’s finished.}\\
\sqt{Then shave thin another piece of rope.}\\
\sqt{Then push bird quills into the other rope.}\\
\sqt{The other shaved rope is there, so…}\\
\sqt{Then put it on there.}\\
\sqt{That's done, and then tie that rope on there and finish.}\\
\sqt{Do the other one like that.}\\
\sqt{(I) came and…}\\
\sqt{(I) went down and washed.}\\
\sqt{(I) finished washing and then…}\\
\sqt{(I) went up and peeled bark strips from an owaːlo tree.}\\
\sqt{I saw that the sun was already setting.}\\
\sqt{It was doing that, so (I) finished peeling the owaːlo bark and then…}\\
\sqt{(I) went to the road and picked up my bilum (string bag).}\\
\sqt{(I) was coming down carrying (the bilum) and…}\\
\sqt{‎‎I was on that other side having crossed the Oːlonaː.}\\
\sqt{We were going and…}\\
\sqt{While we were coming, (the dogs) were barking at a pig and then…}\\
\sqt{In hitting it with the ax…}\\
\sqt{We hit it badly and then…}\\
\sqt{(It was) on the backbone (that we hit it).}\\
\sqt{We did that so…}\\
\sqt{I came there with the knife, and then...}\\
\sqt{I stabbed the pig.}\\
\sqt{I did that then…}\\
\sqt{that pig died.}\\
\sqt{The pig had died, and then…}\\
\sqt{(We) butchered (it).}\\
\sqt{We went and…}\\
\sqt{It got dark, at the riverside.}\\
\sqt{It had gotten dark, so…}\\
\sqt{We still crossed.}\\
\sqt{We crossed the Waːwi river and then…}\\
